description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
age presented in years – see metadata for source of age
age presented in years of participant_2 – see metadata for source of age
name of the two participants that compose the dyad
species of individuals participating in the study - chimpanzee
set of trials - mostly occurring on the same day - usually numerical
presentation of the experiment to the participants - usually numerical

na = no-assistance condition. The partner did not do anything. The experimenter opened up the options for the focal_participant. ra = risky-assistance condition. The partner opened up the options for the focal_participant

location of the prosocial (2/2) option for the focal_participant. This could either have been location B = the two cups in the middle of the table (left from focal_participant POV) or C = the two cups at the back of the table (right from focal_participant POV). See figure 1 in paper.

0 = focal_participant did not choose prosocially (prosocial_option and focal_participant_choice are not the same)/ 1 = focal_participant chose prosocially (prosocial_option and focal_participant_choice are identical).
